a photographic print of a plan for a building, machine etc on special blue paper
a blueprint for the new shopping mall
a pattern that all living cells contain, which decides how a person, animal, or plant develops and what it looks like
By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint, scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
a plan for achieving or improving something
an economic blueprint calling for new investment in training and infrastructure
Labour’s blueprint for an integrated transport system
a detailed photographic copy of a plan for a building or a machine, appearing as white lines on a blue background, used by builders or people who make or repair machines
a blueprint drawn up by a firm of local architects
